sub_title: Dr. | Senior Researcher and Futures Explorer NVWA | Member City District Committee Amsterdam West
summary:
Both in my work and in my private life I am driven by a passion for working towards a better, more sustainable and equal future. Professionally, I am currently working as a futures explorer for the NVWA and help them to anticipate current and future food safety issues. Furthermore, as a member of the Stadsdeelcommissie (City District Committee) of Amsterdam West, I aim to make my own neighborhood more equal and more sustainable. 

I have a broad interdisciplinary background (BSc in Political Science, MSc in Environmental Sciences, PhD in Urban Economics) and I (co-)authored (peer reviewed) articles, essays, scientific reports and books. I am always open for a chat about sustainability, politics or exploring more sustainable and equal futures, so don't hesitate to contact me!

treasury_media.title: City-Region Food Systems and Second Tier Cities: From Garden Cities to Garden Regions
treasury_media.description: Theory and practice show that second-tier cities can play an important role in linking the urban and the rural. Second-tier cities are the middle ground of the urban system. The smaller spatial scale of second-tier cities, and their often-stronger...

projects.title: Towards future scenario's for a circular food economy in Almere
projects.description:
Project commissioned  by Flevocampus.

With the input of different stakeholders (entrepreneurs, citizens, civil servants), we created four future scenario's for the development of circularity in the food economy of Almere.

contributors.headline: Dr. | Senior Researcher and Futures Explorer NVWA | Member City District Committee Amsterdam West

projects.title: Powerful short chains in Almere Oosterwold
projects.description:
Project commissioned by Flevocampus

Almere Oosterwold is a neighborhood in the city of Almere where 50% of the plot of citizens must be alotted to urban agriculture. The municipality has formulated the ambition that over time, 10% of food consumption in Almere must be produced in Oosterwold. In this project, we invited citizens of Oosterwold to engage with the future of urban agriculture in Oosterwold to explore how this ambition can become a reality.

contributors.headline: Dr. | Senior Researcher and Futures Explorer NVWA | Member City District Committee Amsterdam West

projects.title: Circular food economy in Almere and Zeewolde
projects.description:
Project commissioned by the municipality of Almere, in response to the Ellen MacArthur Foundation, Cities and Circular Economy for Food program: City Analysis Almere, The Netherlands.

In this project, the circularity of the food economy in Almere and Zeewolde was explored through desk research, on a range of topics such as food production, distribution, logistics and waste disposal.

contributors.headline: Dr. | Senior Researcher and Futures Explorer NVWA | Member City District Committee Amsterdam West

projects.title: Towards efficient and sustainable local food distribution systems. An explorative study
projects.description:
Project commissioned by AMS (Amsterdam Institute for Metropolitan Solutions) and Flevocampus.

The main objectives of this explorative project were as follows: (1) to explore the potential of local production to meet consumption demand in the MRA; (2) to understand the requirements in the food distribution system for linking local production and consumption; (3) to develop a pilot decision support model to analyze and evaluate the logistical impact of a local distribution system (including costs and environmental impact); and (4) to present research lines based on the explorations in the previous objectives, to work towards scenarios for efficient and sustainable local food distribution systems.

profile_positions.description:
The Netherlands Food and Consumer Product Safety Authority (NVWA) monitors animal and plant health, animal welfare, and the safety of food and consumer products, as well as enforcing nature legislation. The NVWA is an independent agency in the Ministry of Agriculture, Nature and Food Quality and a delivery agency for the Ministry of Health, Welfare and Sport. 

As a senior researcher and advisor, I work for the Office for Risk Assessment & Research (BuRO), an independent department of the NVWA. BuRO provides independent advice to the Inspector-General of the NVWA, to the Dutch Ministry of Health, Welfare and Sport, or the Ministry of Agriculture, Nature and Food Quality. Advice can be provided upon request or upon BuRO’s own initiative. I work particularly for the Trends and Future cluster, which explores what future threats or developments can come up that the NVWA must anticipate.
profile_positions.title: Senior Advisor and Researcher

profile_positions.description:
Amsterdam has 7 city districts. Each city district is managed by a City District Committee (or 'stadsdeelcommissie' in Dutch). This committee is the link between the district and City Hall. They deal with important topics in the district, such as the design of streets and squares, public greenery and parks, household waste collection, and social work in the neighbourhood.

I am a representative of the Dutch Labour Party (PvdA) in the City District Committe of Amsterdam West. My goal is to make my district more sustainable and climate proof, but in such a way that this transformation doesn't increase inequalities but instead helps to reduce them. To give a few examples of what we have acomplished so far: on my iniative we have introduced containergardens, strips of green that surround garbage containers and that help to make the district cleaner and more climate proof. Furthermore, we also initiated a prohibition on terrace heating, which is harmful for the environment and at the same time involves energy saving we so desperately need for affordable energy prices for both citizens as well as entrepreneurs.
profile_positions.title: Member City District Committee Amsterdam West

company.name: Aeres University of Applied Science Almere

profile_positions.company: Aeres University of Applied Science Almere
profile_positions.description:
My position as a researcher at Aeres School of Applied Sciences in Almere was funded by the municipality of Almere and Flevocampus through the 'Kennisstad' research grant. It allowed me to conduct my independent research as an external PhD candidate at Wageningen University and Research and at the same time participate in several applied-scientific research projects on the topic of food, sustainability and urban development. 

Projects:
- Towards a circular food system in Almere (2021-2022)
- Powerful Short Chains in Oosterwold (2020)
- Circulair food economy in Almere and Zeewolde (2019)
- Towards efficient and sustainable local food distribution systems (2018-2019)

Find more information on the projects below under accomplishments
profile_positions.title: Researcher Urban Food and Sustainability

profile_positions.description:
Author of the book "Academische vaardigheden voor interdisciplinaire studies". Also translated in English as "Academic Skills for interdisciplinary studies" A comprehensive manual for interdisciplinary students and academics pertaining to skills for research and knowledge generation and sharing. In 2020, a selection of chapters of this book was used in the publication "Chapters on Interdisciplinary Research and Research Skills".

profile_positions.description:
I was part of the project team 'Handelingsperspectieven Duurzaamheid' (Policy perspectives for sustainable development) chaired by Prof Dr. Ir. Margot Weijnen. Conducted an independent research project on the governance of the Waddenzee area, supervised by Ir. Albert Faber and Dr. Peter de Goede

See the link below for more information about the project
profile_positions.title: Research Internship

profile_positions.description: With a group of researchers from several scientific disciplines, we built an integrative tool for a more holistic MACC (Marginal Abatement Cost Curve) of mitigation plans by Waternet. By adding a technical, social and political dimension, this tool provided Waternet with a comprehensive overview of the costs and benefits of several mitigation plans.

volunteer_experiences.description:
I was the vice-chair on the board of PvdA Duurzaam, an officially recognized network of the Dutch Labour Party (PvdA). We bring together members of the party to discuss and to impact policy and positions of the party on a range of topics relating to sustainability and climate change. As a member of the board, I helped to facilitate this by organizing meetings with party members, politicians and governors, by writing reports and by formulating motions and amendements for official PvdA conventions. 

More information, see our website: 
https://duurzaam.pvda.nl/
